dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3171 IH: To amend the Public Health Service Act to prohibit certain research on the transplantation of human fetal tissue obtained pursuant to an abortion.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Sensenbrenner (for himself and Mr. Duffy) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to prohibit certain research on the transplantation of human fetal tissue obtained pursuant to an abortion.

section.header: Prohibiting certain research on the transplantation of human fetal tissue obtained pursuant to an abortion
section.text: Section 498A(a) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 289g–1(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending paragraph (2) to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on use of tissue obtained pursuant to abortions
paragraph.text: Human fetal tissue may be used in research carried out under paragraph (1) only if the tissue is obtained pursuant to a stillbirth.

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively;

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(1)(B), by striking may have been obtained pursuant to a spontaneous or induced abortion or pursuant to a stillbirth and inserting has been obtained pursuant to a stillbirth; and
in subsection (g), by striking after a spontaneous or induced abortion, or.
